advertisement

Environmental issues  from acid rain to toxic waste  wore several costumes during this falls election performances according to local sources PERIOD

Environmental concerns actually proved to be  said EcoAction President David Long PERIOD

 Long junioreconomics said PERIOD

Judith Johnsrud conservation chairwoman for the Moshannon Group of the Sierra Club agreed PERIOD  she said PERIOD

Johnsrud said under the Reagan administration environmental problems were left to decay PERIOD  she said PERIOD

Campaign officials and television media often are to blame for the lack of attention to environmental problems Johnsrud said adding the attention was often focused on campaign tactics and strategies instead of issues PERIOD

 Johnsrud said PERIOD

Long said 

Robert Schmalz professor of geology said while most remarks made in reference to the environment were derogatory to the other candidate 

Schmalz said he believes Presidentelect George Bush would at least give  to the environmental issues PERIOD 

Robert OConnor assistant professor of political science said he believes environmental issues did play a big part in the election process PERIOD

State Rep PERIOD Ruth Rudy DCentre also said  adding the election 

OConnor said early in the campaign Bush recognized through polling that environmental issues could be a big area of weakness for his campaign PERIOD

 OConnor said PERIOD Bush recognized this he said and put it to  use by using the pollution of Boston Harbor to put Dukakis on the defensive PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

OConnor who will teach a course on environmental politics next semester said Bushs actual interest in environmental issues really does not matter PERIOD 

 OConnor said adding that Congress could override a presidents actions PERIOD OConnor also said nobody wants to look like a pollution advocate PERIOD
